abstract: Determines whether the reference image is valid.
overview:
## Discussion

ARKit considers certain images invalid for image tracking (for example, an image that’s all white). Call this function on a reference image you create programmatically to make sure ARKit can track it, before passing it in to your session’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration/detectionImages] array.

You only need this function when you create a reference image programmatically, because Xcode performs this validation for you when you create a reference image in an asset catalog.

# validate(completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Determines whether the reference image is valid.

## Declaration

```swift
func validate(completionHandler: @escaping ((any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
func validate() async throws
```

## Discussion

ARKit considers certain images invalid for image tracking (for example, an image that’s all white). Call this function on a reference image you create programmatically to make sure ARKit can track it, before passing it in to your session’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration/detectionImages] array.

You only need this function when you create a reference image programmatically, because Xcode performs this validation for you when you create a reference image in an asset catalog.
title: validate(completionHandler:)
